title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 5, 2019).

The Ukrainian administration tried over several months to sort through conflicting signals from Washington that have now become central to an impeachment inquiry into Trump.

House Democrats leading the impeachment probe subpoenaed the White House and asked Pence for documents related to Trump's policy toward Ukraine.

Sanders had a heart attack this week, the Democratic presidential candidate's campaign said. He was released from the hospital.

The White House issued a presidential proclamation requiring many future immigrant visa applicants to show they can afford health care.

Microsoft said that at least one U.S. presidential campaign has been targeted by cyberattacks linked to the Iranian government.

The U.K. said it would respect a law forcing it to request an extension to Brexit negotiations if a deal isn't reached by Oct. 19.

The Supreme Court has agreed to review a Louisiana abortion law requiring doctors to hold hospital admitting privileges near where the procedure is provided.

India's central bank reduced its key lending rate to a nine-year low.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 05, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
